subject: Art & Design
title: The Power of the Fashion Editor
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Power of the Fashion Editor.

hook.text: Anna Wintour sits front row at every show. Designers court her approval. A Vogue feature can make or break a career.

buildup.text: Fashion editors â€” at Vogue, Harper's Bazaar, Elle â€” curate trends, champion designers, and shape public taste.

discovery.text: Diana Vreeland (Vogue, 1960s) declared 'pink is the navy blue of India.' She didn't report trends â€” she invented them.

twist.text: Social media influencers now rival editors' power. A TikTok viral moment reaches more people than any magazine cover.

climax.text: The industry is shifting from top-down tastemaking to democratized influence. But elite gatekeepers still set the tone.

punchline.text: Fashion editors don't follow trends. They decide which ones exist.

quiz.question: How have social media influencers changed fashion's power structure?
options: They rival traditional editors by reaching larger audiences and democratizing trend-setting
They have no impact on fashion industry decisions
They only promote fast fashion brands
